oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Leroy M. Sullivan correspondence with Grady M. Long, August 4
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Sullivan, Leroy M., 1921-1943
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Leroy Sullivan to Grady Long apologizing for taking so long to write and reminiscing about his "mis-spent" youth in Chattanooga, Tennessee. In addition to offering his opinion on Germans, Sullivan describes his leisure time and requests some more "dirty literature" from Long. Sullivan closes his letter with thoughts about going back to school after the war and praising the American Red Cross.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Soldiers -- United States -- History -- 20th century; World War, 1939-1945 -- War work -- Red Cross
Sullivan, Leroy M., 1921-1943
American Red Cross; Canada. Royal Canadian Air Force; Great Britain. Royal Air Force. Squadron 56
